list: Please complete this voluntary questionnaire for {{ first_non_empty_item(metadata['trad_as'], metadata['ru_name']) }}.
If this business is part of an enterprise group, please answer all questions for this business in the UK only.
Do not include results for subsidiaries or parent enterprises.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.description: Definition of Innovation

list: Innovation, for the purpose of this survey, is defined as new or significantly improved goods or services as well as processes used to produce or supply all goods or services that have been introduced, regardless of their origin.
These innovations may be new to you or new to the market.

Investments for future innovation and changes that {{ first_non_empty_item(metadata['trad_as'], metadata['ru_name']) }} has introduced at a strategic level (in organisation and practices) are also covered.

content.description: Read more information about this survey here.

blocks.title: Business strategy and practices
blocks.description: This section asks for information about changes in business strategy and practices, for example, implementing changes to marketing concepts or strategies.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} make changes in any of the following areas for the purposes of current or future innovation?

content.description: Include:

list: new and significantly improved forms of organisation, business structures or practices aimed at raising internal efficiency or the effectiveness of approaching markets and customers

content.description: Exclude:

list: changes that are still in progress

options.label: New business practices for organising procedures
options.value: New business practices for organising procedures
options.description: For example first use of supply chain management, business re-engineering, knowledge management, lean production or quality management

options.label: New methods of organising work responsibilities and decision making
options.value: New methods of organising work responsibilities and decision making
options.description: For example first use of a new system of employee responsibilities, team work, decentralisation, integration or de-integration of departments or education or training systems

options.label: New methods of organising external relationships with other firms or public institutions
options.value: New methods of organising external relationships with other firms or public institutions
options.description: For example first use of alliances, partnerships, outsourcing or subcontracting

options.label: Implementation of significant changes to marketing concepts or strategies
options.value: Implementation of significant changes to marketing concepts or strategies
options.description: For example a marketing concept or strategy that differs significantly from your enterprise's existing marketing methods which has not been used before

options.label: Logistics, delivery or distribution methods
options.description: For example transportation, service delivery, warehousing or order processing

options.label: Methods for information processing or communication
options.value: Methods for information processing or communication
options.description: The maintenance and provision of information and communication systems, for example hardware, software, data processing, database, maintenance, repair, web-hosting and other computer related information activities

options.label: Methods for accounting or other administrative operations
options.value: Methods for accounting or other administrative operations
options.description: For example accounting, bookkeeping, auditing, payments, financial or insurance activities and procurement

blocks.title: Innovation investment
blocks.description: This section asks for information on innovation activities during the 3 year period 2018 to 2020 and investments in innovations in the calendar year 2020.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020 did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} invest in internal Research and Development (R&D) for the purposes of current or future innovation?

definitions.title: What we mean by "internal Research and Development"

content.description: This refers to creative and systematic work undertaken within your business that increases the stock of knowledge, and in order to devise new applications of available knowledge for developing new and improved goods or services and processes.
R&D activity must have elements of all of these five criteria:

questions.title: In which of the following years did your business invest in internal Research and Development?
How much did your business spend on internal Research and Development (R&D) in the calendar year 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data available

content.description: Include:

answers.label: Total expenditure on internal Research and Development (R&D)
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} invest in the acquisition of Research and Development for the purposes of current or future innovation?

content.description: Include creative work undertaken by companies, including other businesses within your group, or by public or private research organisations and purchased by your business.

questions.title: How much did your business spend on acquisitions of Research and Development in the calendar year 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data is available

content.description: Include:

answers.label: Total expenditure on acquisition of Research and Development
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} invest in the acquisition of machinery and equipment, computer hardware or software for the purposes of current or future innovation?

definitions.title: What we mean by "machinery and equipment, computer hardware or software"

content.description: Machinery and equipment

This refers to an asset with moving parts that is used by a business for the purpose of carrying on the business. It covers  major (i.e. capitalised) machinery and equipment acquired for use in the performance of innovation by the business
Hardware
This refers to the physical parts of a computer, for example:
Software
This refers to the data or instructions that tells a computer how to work, for example:

list: Supporting materials for systems and applications

questions.title: Which of the following did your business invest in for the purposes of current or future innovation?

options.label: Machinery and/or equipment
options.description: Major (i.e. capitalised) machinery and equipment acquired for use in the performance of innovation by the business

options.label: Computer hardware
options.description: For example computer monitors and terminals, printers, keyboards and computer projectors, servers

options.label: Computer software
options.description: For example program descriptions, extensions, supporting materials for systems and applications

questions.title: How much did your business spend on the acquisition of machinery and equipment, computer hardware or software in the calendar year 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data available

content.description: Include:

answers.label: Total expenditure for the acquisition of advanced machinery, equipment and software
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} invest in the acquisition of existing knowledge for the purposes of current or future innovation?

content.description: Include purchase or licensing of patents and non-patented inventions, know-how and other types of knowledge from other businesses or organisations

questions.title: How much did your business spend on acquisitions of existing knowledge in the calendar year 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data available

content.description: Include:

answers.label: Total expenditure for the acquisition of existing knowledge
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} invest in training for innovative activities for the purposes of current or future innovation?

content.description: Include internal or external training for your personnel, specifically for the development or implementation of new or improved goods, services and processes

questions.title: How much did your business spend on training for innovative activities in the calendar year 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data available

content.description: Include:

answers.label: Total expenditure on training for innovative activities
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} invest in any form of design activity for the purposes of current or future innovation?

content.description: Include engagement in design activities, including strategic, for the development or implementation of new or improved goods, services and processes
This refers to the design of goods or services (including artistic design) to   develop a new or modified form, appearance or function for goods or services.

questions.title: How much did your business spend on all forms of design activity, for the purposes of current or future innovation, in the calendar year 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data is available

content.description: Include:

answers.label: Total expenditure for all forms of design activity
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} invest in market introduction of innovations for the purposes of current or future innovation?

content.description: Include:

list: changes to product or service design
advertising for a product or service launch

definitions.title: What we mean by "market introduction of innovations"

content.description: This refers to internal or external work intended to enhance reputation or brand values, either of the business as a whole or individual goods or service lines, as well as to support the market placement of new goods and services.

questions.title: Which of the following did your business invest in for the purposes of current or future innovation?

options.label: Changes to product or service design
options.value: Changes to product or service design

options.label: Advertising for a product or service launch
options.value: Advertising for a product or service launch

questions.title: How much did your business spend on the market introduction of innovations in the calendar year 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data available

content.description: Include:

answers.label: Total expenditure for market introduction of innovations
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

blocks.title: Goods or services innovation
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about innovation relating to goods or services.

You will first be asked to provide information about any new or significantly improved goods introduced by your business; and second to provide information relating to any new or significantly improved services.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} introduce new or significantly improved goods?

content.description: Include:

list: all new or significantly improved goods (for example, improvement in quality or distinct user benefits)
goods innovations that are new to the business, even if they are not new to the market
all product innovations, regardless of their origin

content.description: Exclude:

list: the simple resale of  goods purchased from other businesses and changes of a solely aesthetic nature

questions.title: Who was primarily responsible for developing these new or significantly improved goods?

options.label: This business with other businesses or organisations
options.value: This business with other businesses or organisations

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} introduce new or significantly improved services?

content.description: Include:

list: all new or significantly improved  services (for example, improvement in quality or distinct user benefits)
all services innovations, regardless of their origin

questions.title: Who was primarily responsible for developing the new or significantly improved services?

options.label: This business with other businesses or organisations
options.value: This business with other businesses or organisations

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, were any of your goods or services innovations new to the market?

content.description: Include goods or services this business introduced to the market before competitors

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, were any of your goods or services innovations only new to your business?

content.description: Include new goods or services that were essentially the same as goods or services already available from competitors

blocks.title: Process innovation
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about innovation relating to processes for the production or supply of goods or services including all new or significantly improved methods of production.

You will be asked to provide general information about process innovation for your business during the 3 year period 2018 to 2020.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} introduce any new or significantly improved processes for producing or supplying goods or services?

content.description: Include:

list: all new or significantly improved methods for the production or supply of goods or services
process innovations that are new to the business even if they are not new to your industry
all process innovations, regardless of their origin

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, if {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} had no innovation activity, why has it not been necessary or possible to innovate?

options.label: No need due to previous innovations
options.value: No need due to previous innovations

options.label: No need due to market conditions
options.value: No need due to market conditions

options.label: The UK does not have a business environment which encourages companies to innovate
options.value: The UK does not have a business environment which encourages companies to innovate

values: No need due to previous innovations
No need due to market conditions
The UK does not have a business environment which encourages companies to innovate
New business practices for organising procedures
New methods of organising work responsibilities and decision making
New methods of organising external relationships with other firms or public institutions
Implementation of significant changes to marketing concepts or strategies
Methods for information processing or communication
Methods for accounting or other administrative operations

questions.title: Who was primarily responsible for developing these processes?

options.label: This business with other businesses or organisations
options.value: This business with other businesses or organisations

blocks.title: Constraints on innovation
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about constraints on innovation in your business.

You will be asked to provide information on the status of innovation activities and the importance of different factors that may be constraining innovation.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} have any innovation activities that were abandoned, scaled back or ongoing?

options.label: Innovation activities were still ongoing at the end of 2020
options.value: Innovation activities were still ongoing at the end of 2020

options.label: No, there were no innovation activities that were abandoned, scaled back or ongoing at the end of 2020
options.value: No, there were no innovation activities that were abandoned, scaled back or ongoing at the end of 2020

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was any excessive perceived economic risk in constraining innovation activities?
questions.description: What constitutes an answer of 'high', 'medium', 'low' or 'not important' is dependent on your own interpretation in relation to {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}.

content.description: This refers to the possibility that economic conditions such as exchange rates, government regulation, or political stability will affect a business’s activities.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important were direct innovation costs of innovation being too high in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was the cost of finance in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was the availability of finance in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was the lack of available qualified personnel in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was the lack of information on technology in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was the lack of information on markets in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was the effect of a market dominated by established businesses in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was a perceived uncertain demand for innovative goods or services in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important were UK government regulations in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important were EU regulations (including standards) in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union in constraining innovation activities?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important were issues related to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic in constraining innovation activities?

values: No need due to previous innovations
No need due to market conditions
The UK does not have a business environment which encourages companies to innovate

blocks.title: Factors affecting Innovation
blocks.description: This section asks for information about factors affecting innovation. You will be asked to provide information on how important various factors were in your decision to innovate goods, services, and/or processes.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was increasing the range of goods or services in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was entering new markets in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was increasing market share in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was improving the quality of goods or services in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was improving flexibility for producing goods or services in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was improving capacity for producing goods or services in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was increasing value added in your decision to innovate?

content.description: This refers to increasing the difference between the price of a product or service and the cost of producing it.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was reducing costs per unit produced or provided in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was improving health and safety in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was reducing environmental impacts in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was replacing outdated products or processes in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important was meeting regulatory requirements, including standards, in your decision to innovate?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important were issues related to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic in your decision to innovate?

values: No need due to previous innovations
No need due to market conditions
The UK does not have a business environment which encourages companies to innovate

blocks.title: Information needed for innovation
blocks.description: This section asks for information needed for innovation. You will be asked to provide information about the importance of various information sources to your business’s innovation activities.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s innovation activities was information from within your business or enterprise group?

content.description: This refers to a group of legal units under common ownership.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from suppliers of equipment, materials, services or software?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from clients or customers from the private sector?

content.description: The private sector refers to the part of the economy that is for profit and is owned by private organisations or individuals.
Examples of the private sector:

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from clients or customers from the public sector?

content.description: The public sector includes government owned organisations.
For example:

list: Local, regional and national administrations and agencies
Government providers of services such as security, transport, housing and energy etc.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from competitors or other businesses in your industry?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from consultants, commercial laboratories or private Research and Development institutes?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from universities or other higher education institutes?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from government or public research institutes?

definitions.title: What we mean by "public research institutes"

content.description: This refers to research institutes that are either owned or controlled by the government or rely largely on government block funding for research activities.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from conferences, trade fairs or exhibitions?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from professional and industry associations?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from technical, industry or service standards?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from scientific journals and trade or technical publications?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, how important to your business's innovation activities was information from social web-based networks or crowd-sourcing?

values: No need due to previous innovations
No need due to market conditions
The UK does not have a business environment which encourages companies to innovate

blocks.title: Innovation protection
blocks.description: This section asks for information about protection of your innovations, for example, trademarks or patents.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, what proportions of your innovations were protected by patents?

content.description: This refers to a type of applied for intellectual property that protects inventions and products, for example machines and machine parts, tools, medicines, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, what proportions of your innovations were protected by design registration?

content.description: This refers to a type of applied for intellectual property that protects the appearance of a product including, shape, packaging, patterns, colours, decoration, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, what proportions of your innovations were protected by copyright?

content.description: This refers to a type of automatic intellectual property that protects writing and literary works, art, photography, films, TV, music, web content, sound recordings, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, what proportions of your innovations were protected by trademarks?

content.description: This refers to a type of applied for intellectual property that protects product names, logos, jingles, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, what proportions of your innovations were protected by lead time advantages?

content.description: This refers to the time between initiating and completing any business process.
For example:

list: the time it takes to manufacture an item
the time it takes to make a purchased item available in inventory after it is received

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, what proportions of your innovations were protected by complexity of goods or services?
During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, what proportions of your innovations were protected by secrecy?

content.description: Include non-disclosure agreements

values: No need due to previous innovations
No need due to market conditions
The UK does not have a business environment which encourages companies to innovate

blocks.title: Public financial support for innovation
blocks.description: This section asks for information about public financial support for innovation received from government, specifying the type, if any, of public financial support your business received and the source; for example, research and development tax credits received from UK central government.

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} receive public financial support for innovation activities from the following levels of government?

content.description: Include:

list: financial support via tax credits or deductions, grants, subsidised loans and loans guarantees

content.description: Exclude:

list: research and development and other innovations activities conducted entirely for the public sector under contract

options.label: UK central government
options.description: Include: UK government's agencies or funding bodies for example Innovate UK, formerly known as TSB

options.label: European Union (EU) institutions or programmes
options.description: Include: EU Horizon - Programme for Research and Innovation

options.label: No public financial support was received for innovation activities from government
options.value: No public financial support was received for innovation activities from government

values: No public financial support was received for innovation activities from government

questions.title: What kind of financial support was received by your business from UK central government?

options.label: Direct financial support
options.description: For example Smart or Collaborative research and development grants, work with Catapult centres, Innovation vouchers

options.label: Indirect financial support – Research and Development tax credits
options.value: Indirect financial support – Research and Development tax credits

options.label: Indirect financial support – Patent box, coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic support
options.value: Indirect financial support – Patent box, coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic support

blocks.title: Turnover and exports
blocks.description: This section asks for information about total value of turnover excluding VAT for calendar years 2018 and 2020, as well as an estimate of your business’s total value of exports for the calendar year 2020.

questions.title: What was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s total turnover, excluding VAT, for the calendar years 2018 and 2020?
questions.description: Please estimate if no precise accounting data is available.

content.description: This refers to the market sales of goods and services, including all taxes except VAT. For Credit institutions, interests receivable and similar income; for insurance services give gross premiums written.

answers.label: Total estimated turnover for 2018
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

questions.title: What was the estimated percentage of your business's total turnover in 2020 from goods and services for each of the following definitions?

content.description: Include:

list: turnover for goods and services introduced during the calendar year 2020 only
100% in the 'Unchanged or only marginally modified' answer field if  your business did not introduce any new or significantly improved goods or services

answers.label: Goods and services new to the market in 2018 to 2020
Goods and services only new to this business in 2018 to 2020
Goods and services that were significantly improved in 2018 to 2020
Goods and services that remained unchanged or only marginally modified

questions.title: What was your business's total estimated value of exports for the calendar year 2020 only, excluding VAT?

answers.label: Total value of exports for 2020
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000

blocks.title: Employees and skills
blocks.description: This section asks for information relating to persons employed by your business. You will be asked to provide estimates for the total number of employees for the calendar years 2018 and 2020, an estimate of the proportion of your workforce who hold a degree or higher qualification and information regarding the skills possessed by employees, for example, mathematics or statistics.

questions.title: What was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s estimated number of employees for the calendar years 2018 and 2020?
What was the proportion of employees who held a degree or higher qualification in the following areas for the calendar year 2020?
questions.description:
For example: BS, BSc, MA, PhD, PGCE

You can provide an estimate if you are not sure

questions.title: During the 3 year period 2018 to 2020, did your business employ individuals in-house with the following skills at any level, or obtain these skills from external sources?

options.label: Multimedia, web design
options.description: For example, audio, graphics, text, still pictures, animation or video

blocks.title: General information
blocks.description: This section gives the opportunity to provide additional comments.

questions.title: Please provide any additional information that will help us understand the answers you have provided
How long did it take you to complete this questionnaire?

content.description: Include:

list: the time taken to become familiar with the questionnaire
the time of everyone who helped you to complete the questionnaire
the time spent extracting and preparing information from your systems
any other time spent in relation to completing the questionnaire

questions.title: Would {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} be willing to be contacted by telephone by the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy or its appointed agents, to ask some further questions about innovation?
